Description: Rectangular limestone stela of Maria; design includes bird, cross and foliate border. Description from Hall: Two panels: in the centre of the lower panel is a dove with outstretched wings: a medallion is hung about its neck. Below it is a triple guilloche scroll, in each of the six circles of which is a foliated cross, and in the inner spandrels small discs, each with a plain diagonal cross incised upon it. Above it is the inscription … . The whole panel is enclosed within a rectangular border of leaves on a central stalk. Above this is a square panel containing a cross pattee within a wreath: in the spandrels are foliated ornaments. Both panels are contained within a border of vine scrolls.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Hall, Coptic and Greek Texts (1905): 133, pl. 92; N. Strudwick, Masterpieces of Ancient Egypt, London 2006, pp. 330-1.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.133, pl.92)
Acquisition notes: Comes in the register with the general comment for this page 'Purch. by Budge'
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: I.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 92:1 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
